23#if __APPLE__
24// In Mac OS X 10.5 and later trying to use the daemon function gives a “‘daemon’ is deprecated”
25// error, which prevents compilation because we build with "-Werror".
26// Since this is supposed to be portable cross-platform code, we don't care that daemon is
27// deprecated on Mac OS X 10.5, so we use this preprocessor trick to eliminate the error message.
28#define daemon yes_we_know_that_daemon_is_deprecated_in_os_x_10_5_thankyou
29#endif
30
31#include <stdio.h>
32#include <string.h>
33#include <unistd.h>
34#include <stdlib.h>
35#include <signal.h>
36#include <errno.h>
37#include <fcntl.h>
38#include <pwd.h>
39#include <sys/types.h>
40
41#if __APPLE__
42#undef daemon
43extern int daemon(int, int);
44#endif
45
46#include "mDNSEmbeddedAPI.h"
47#include "mDNSPosix.h"
48#include "mDNSUNP.h" // For daemon()
49#include "uds_daemon.h"
50#include "PlatformCommon.h"
51#include "DNSCommon.h"
52
53#define CONFIG_FILE "/etc/mdnsd.conf"
54static domainname DynDNSZone; // Default wide-area zone for service registration
55static domainname DynDNSHostname;
56
57#define RR_CACHE_SIZE 500
58static CacheEntity gRRCache[RR_CACHE_SIZE];
59static mDNS_PlatformSupport PlatformStorage;
60
61mDNSlocal void mDNS_StatusCallback(mDNS *const m, mStatus result)
62{
63 (void)m; // Unused
64 if (result == mStatus_NoError)
65 {
66 // On successful registration of dot-local mDNS host name, daemon may want to check if
67 // any name conflict and automatic renaming took place, and if so, record the newly negotiated
68 // name in persistent storage for next time. It should also inform the user of the name change.
69 // On Mac OS X we store the current dot-local mDNS host name in the SCPreferences store,
70 // and notify the user with a CFUserNotification.
71 }
72 else if (result == mStatus_ConfigChanged)
73 {
74 udsserver_handle_configchange(m);
75 }
76 else if (result == mStatus_GrowCache)
77 {
78 // Allocate another chunk of cache storage
79 CacheEntity *storage = malloc(sizeof(CacheEntity) * RR_CACHE_SIZE);
80 if (storage) mDNS_GrowCache(m, storage, RR_CACHE_SIZE);
81 }
82}
83
84// %%% Reconfigure() probably belongs in the platform support layer (mDNSPosix.c), not the daemon cde
85// -- all client layers running on top of mDNSPosix.c need to handle network configuration changes,
86// not only the Unix Domain Socket Daemon
87
88static void Reconfigure(mDNS *m)
89{
90 mDNSAddr DynDNSIP;
91 const mDNSAddr dummy = { mDNSAddrType_IPv4, { { { 1, 1, 1, 1 } } } };;
92 mDNS_SetPrimaryInterfaceInfo(m, NULL, NULL, NULL);
93 mDNS_Lock(m);
94 if (ParseDNSServers(m, uDNS_SERVERS_FILE) < 0)
95 LogMsg("Unable to parse DNS server list. Unicast DNS-SD unavailable");
96 mDNS_Unlock(m);
97 ReadDDNSSettingsFromConfFile(m, CONFIG_FILE, &DynDNSHostname, &DynDNSZone, NULL);
98 mDNSPlatformSourceAddrForDest(&DynDNSIP, &dummy);
99 if (DynDNSHostname.c[0]) mDNS_AddDynDNSHostName(m, &DynDNSHostname, NULL, NULL);
100 if (DynDNSIP.type) mDNS_SetPrimaryInterfaceInfo(m, &DynDNSIP, NULL, NULL);
101 mDNS_ConfigChanged(m);
102}
103
104// Do appropriate things at startup with command line arguments. Calls exit() if unhappy.
105mDNSlocal void ParseCmdLinArgs(int argc, char **argv)
106{
107 if (argc > 1)
108 {
109 if (0 == strcmp(argv[1], "-debug")) mDNS_DebugMode = mDNStrue;
110 else printf("Usage: %s [-debug]\n", argv[0]);
111 }
112
113 if (!mDNS_DebugMode)
114 {
115 int result = daemon(0, 0);
116 if (result != 0) { LogMsg("Could not run as daemon - exiting"); exit(result); }
117#if __APPLE__
118 LogMsg("The POSIX mdnsd should only be used on OS X for testing - exiting");
119 exit(-1);
120#endif
121 }
122}
123
124mDNSlocal void DumpStateLog()
125// Dump a little log of what we've been up to.
126{
127 LogMsg("---- BEGIN STATE LOG ----");
128 udsserver_info();
129 LogMsg("---- END STATE LOG ----");
130}
131
132mDNSlocal mStatus MainLoop(mDNS *m) // Loop until we quit.
133{
134 sigset_t signals;
135 mDNSBool gotData = mDNSfalse;
136
137 mDNSPosixListenForSignalInEventLoop(SIGINT);
138 mDNSPosixListenForSignalInEventLoop(SIGTERM);
139 mDNSPosixListenForSignalInEventLoop(SIGUSR1);
140 mDNSPosixListenForSignalInEventLoop(SIGPIPE);
141 mDNSPosixListenForSignalInEventLoop(SIGHUP) ;
142
143 for (; ;)
144 {
145 // Work out how long we expect to sleep before the next scheduled task
146 struct timeval timeout;
147 mDNSs32 ticks;
148
149 // Only idle if we didn't find any data the last time around
150 if (!gotData)
151 {
152 mDNSs32 nextTimerEvent = mDNS_Execute(m);
153 nextTimerEvent = udsserver_idle(nextTimerEvent);
154 ticks = nextTimerEvent - mDNS_TimeNow(m);
155 if (ticks < 1) ticks = 1;
156 }
157 else // otherwise call EventLoop again with 0 timemout
158 ticks = 0;
159
160 timeout.tv_sec = ticks / mDNSPlatformOneSecond;
161 timeout.tv_usec = (ticks % mDNSPlatformOneSecond) * 1000000 / mDNSPlatformOneSecond;
162
163 (void) mDNSPosixRunEventLoopOnce(m, &timeout, &signals, &gotData);
164
165 if (sigismember(&signals, SIGHUP )) Reconfigure(m);
166 if (sigismember(&signals, SIGUSR1)) DumpStateLog();
167 // SIGPIPE happens when we try to write to a dead client; death should be detected soon in request_callback() and cleaned up.
168 if (sigismember(&signals, SIGPIPE)) LogMsg("Received SIGPIPE - ignoring");
169 if (sigismember(&signals, SIGINT) || sigismember(&signals, SIGTERM)) break;
170 }
171 return EINTR;
172}
173
174int main(int argc, char **argv)
175{
176 mStatus err;
177
178 ParseCmdLinArgs(argc, argv);
179
180 LogMsg("%s starting", mDNSResponderVersionString);
181
182 err = mDNS_Init(&mDNSStorage, &PlatformStorage, gRRCache, RR_CACHE_SIZE, mDNS_Init_AdvertiseLocalAddresses,
183 mDNS_StatusCallback, mDNS_Init_NoInitCallbackContext);
184
185 if (mStatus_NoError == err)
186 err = udsserver_init(mDNSNULL, 0);
187
188 Reconfigure(&mDNSStorage);
189
190 // Now that we're finished with anything privileged, switch over to running as "nobody"
191 if (mStatus_NoError == err)
192 {
193 const struct passwd *pw = getpwnam("nobody");
194 if (pw != NULL)
195 setuid(pw->pw_uid);
196 else
197 LogMsg("WARNING: mdnsd continuing as root because user \"nobody\" does not exist");
198 }
199
200 if (mStatus_NoError == err)
201 err = MainLoop(&mDNSStorage);
202
203 LogMsg("%s stopping", mDNSResponderVersionString);
204
205 mDNS_Close(&mDNSStorage);
206
207 if (udsserver_exit() < 0)
208 LogMsg("ExitCallback: udsserver_exit failed");
209
210 #if MDNS_DEBUGMSGS > 0
211 printf("mDNSResponder exiting normally with %ld\n", err);
212 #endif
213
214 return err;
215}
216
217// uds_daemon support ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
218
219mStatus udsSupportAddFDToEventLoop(int fd, udsEventCallback callback, void *context, void **platform_data)
220/* Support routine for uds_daemon.c */
221{
222 // Depends on the fact that udsEventCallback == mDNSPosixEventCallback
223 (void) platform_data;
224 return mDNSPosixAddFDToEventLoop(fd, callback, context);
225}
226
227int udsSupportReadFD(dnssd_sock_t fd, char *buf, int len, int flags, void *platform_data)
228{
229 (void) platform_data;
230 return recv(fd, buf, len, flags);
231}
232
233mStatus udsSupportRemoveFDFromEventLoop(int fd, void *platform_data) // Note: This also CLOSES the file descriptor
234{
235 mStatus err = mDNSPosixRemoveFDFromEventLoop(fd);
236 (void) platform_data;
237 close(fd);
238 return err;
239}
240
241mDNSexport void RecordUpdatedNiceLabel(mDNSs32 delay)
242{
243 (void)delay;
244 // No-op, for now
245}
246
247#if _BUILDING_XCODE_PROJECT_
248// If the process crashes, then this string will be magically included in the automatically-generated crash log
249const char *__crashreporter_info__ = mDNSResponderVersionString_SCCS + 5;
250asm (".desc ___crashreporter_info__, 0x10");
251#endif
252
253// For convenience when using the "strings" command, this is the last thing in the file
254#if mDNSResponderVersion > 1
255mDNSexport const char mDNSResponderVersionString_SCCS[] = "@(#) mDNSResponder-" STRINGIFY(mDNSResponderVersion)
256#ifndef MDNS_VERSIONSTR_NODTS
257 " (" __DATE__ " " __TIME__ ")"
258#endif
259;
260#else
261mDNSexport const char mDNSResponderVersionString_SCCS[] = "@(#) mDNSResponder (Engineering Build)"
262#ifndef MDNS_VERSIONSTR_NODTS
263 " (" __DATE__ " " __TIME__ ")"
264#endif
265;
266#endif
